segments.text: The woman is so focused on drying that plate, and it’s kind of sad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t see the water overflowing or the kids behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for her because she’s missing everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being sneaky, but they’re just having fun.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really going for those cookies, and I hope he doesn’t fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is so sweet, just waiting for her turn.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish the woman would turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a missed connection, and it makes me a little melancholy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to reach out and tell her to look, to be part of the moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But she’s just standing there, in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR
